meanings.definition: A person who earnestly requests or urges someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The adjurer pleaded with his friend to come to the party.
meanings.sent2: The adjurer asked his sister to help him with his homework.
meanings.sent3: The adjurer tried to convince his cat to take a bath, but the cat was not interested.
meanings.sent4: The adjurer's words were like a gentle breeze, softly nudging others towards action.
meanings.sent5: The adjurer's passion for change was contagious, inspiring those around him.

meanings.definition: To earnestly request or urge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She would adjurer her students to always strive for their best.
meanings.sent2: He would adjurer his team to never give up, no matter the odds.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to adjurer the rabbit out of the hat, but it seemed to have disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her words adjurered him to take a leap of faith and pursue his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The coach's speech adjurered the players to give it their all on the field.
